form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Sullivan introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To improve counseling and access to information relating to foster care for military families.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Nikolas Hughey Securing Adoption and Foster Eligibility and Homes for Kids Act or the Nikolas Hughey SAFE Homes for Kids Act.

section.header: Improved counseling and access to information relating to foster care for military families

paragraph.text: The Secretary of Defense shall require all counselors assigned to a Family Advocacy Program or Military and Family Life program at a military installation in the United States to be trained in the requirements and resources relating to foster care of the State in which the installation is located.
A counselor who has received training under paragraph (1) shall be known as a foster care liaison.

subsection.header: Inclusion of foster care information on Military OneSource
subsection.text: The Secretary shall require Military OneSource to include a mechanism for military families to obtain information on foster care, including the requirements and resources relating to foster care of each State.

subsection.header: Collaboration with Administration for Children and Families
subsection.text: The Secretary shall work with the Administration for Children and Families of the Department of Health and Human Services to obtain resources relating to foster care for military families, including curricula for training under paragraph (1).
